good news. I think I got a fix for what appears to be the image rotation issue, at least it works on the images we were able to repro from midori’s gallery and should work for any image that is relying on its exif tags for orientation.

Here’s the run, we weren’t able to repro with that existing image because of what midori suspected, that slack is cleaning up the image tags when we re-download it from here, which is why we were having trouble repro-ing on the original pic.
The reason the image is displaying alright when in the Moments preview display and on the Crop Activity is that we use Glide there and pass the file and so Glide is able to properly orient the image.
In the BitmapRegionLoader right now, that code handles getting an orientation in degrees passed to it, but all of the calling methods to it call the default method (which always passes in 0 for rotation). 

Anywho, the fix is fortunately a low-risk patch because the BitmapRegionLoader is already built to handle this, and also fortunately, the fix comes in when reading the file (so it doesn’t matter for these existing users if the data is already loaded into one of the LiveCase databases. <@U13GPDA1F> would you want me to cut a build + branch with this?

<@U1ZG1UCAK|midori> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/midori/F4HPRS960/nfcchip-03_13_17-v1.apk|NfcChip-03_13_17-v1.apk> and commented: Also, here's an NfcChip apk. <@U13GPDA1F> can you take a look?

<@U3ZFEAPSP> question that popped up from testing the new places style update: there is no indication that the user’s legacy styles (case or selected wallpaper) are different from the new styles or each other. so for example - talkback for what they are testing says “vivid” for both though one is blue and one is pink
is there a way we can have talkback indicate both style + color for those legacy styles?
so like “blue vivid” or “pink vivid” (or whatever it is)
alternatively we could maybe label them as case image / legacy wallpaper
but the goal would be to differentiate some way for talkback users
so just let me know your thoughts / what you think the best approach is given whats possible
<https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_JWq5iYq6D-WVlRMnFTa01JdWM>
^^ a folder with exif images

Looking into that, we could do that, it would take about an hour to dev then testing through it. We may want review for the legacy colors that could be selected, like ‘“Primitive Modern 10”’ and ‘Brick 09’
There are no translations for the colorways either, just as a heads up,  (but as far as impact goes, I would be interested in how many legacy Places users have talkback + foreign language to see if we should worry about the turnaround time for translations…)
ill take that build first, but then, yeah would be great to dive into the places things

text: right now, cropping is sort of messing up my fix, so I’m going to dig into that
works w/o crop, just as a heads up

so for one, my suspicion for the reason midori’s pics are difficult to crop is that the imageView is being handled by Glide and then is rotated and displayed properly, but all the cropping overlay code is not rotating the image and is still saving a rotated image. 
The cropping fix is going to take a bit longer to fix, I’m not sure how long it will be, I don’t think I will have something I feel good about by end of today, I’m going to have to poke around the cropping code for a while to make sure I understand it better first
I can get a build out that is a partial fix if you would like, it works as long as you don’t crop the photo
can you pull the exif data from the bitmap in the asynctask that crops?
yea, I was going to try to get the rotation amount before the image is processed to then to a quick matrix rotate
since the pixel values are done in view space, with the photo rotated correctly, then it should be fine to rely on that coordspace
<https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/ExifInterface.html>
cool ill wait on build until we get that resolve :+1: no need to share until then but appreciate the heads up
sorry posted in a thread, but no need for partial fix build - id prefer to retest once we get that piece resolved <@U3ZFEAPSP>
I have the Exif piece handled, it is the decoding the MomentsImage where I am trying to figure where to cut in and rotate
I was also wanting to confirm that the Glide display being rotated and that overlay view had an actual 1-1 pixel mapping, but I think you just answered that, so that saves some poking around that
<@U13GPDA1F> sounds good, I'll send out when I get the crop portion fixed too
